Other than that, it's a brilliant typing program which supports alternative layouts, and functionality.

description:
It worked for me when I ran it with QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb /usr/bin/ktouch or QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb /usr/bin/ktouch &

Otherwhise I have only just opend it.

The app works as expected and I had no problems setting it up (Fedora Linux), so 🟉 for that. Another 🟉 is for the UI - it is nice and intuivive and overall a good learning interface.

What I am not liking too much are the tests itself and learning style - I chose the intl. English keyboard - THE keyboard of most programmers - and the tests are autogenerated (i.e. unintuitive). A pity, given that a lot of thought can go to making meaningful tests that build the correct muscle memory, instead letting users struggle with random strings of random letters.
I also find it a bit odd that letters from top and bottom rows are added before even finishing the middle row - why 'c' before 'g' and 'h'? Also, why aren't other symbols added, like ',' or '.' or '/'?
Learning software has main goal to teach, and even if I have my reservations, it can definitely teach, and if it's your thing and you enjoy it, go ahead! However, it fails to do the second most important thing a learning software should - motivate. The harsh 98% focus on accuracy is not bad, as the real goal should be high accuracy, but for beginners, the repetitive "You have not passed the lesson" may be quite demotivating.

description:
Loaded and worked OK on Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS on 9/7/2023. I've always liked this typing tutor. It requires a lot of concentration in the begining lessons because you're typing nonsense, but as you add more letters the lessons become recognizable words and sylables instead of gibberish and you don't need to concentrate as much on each individual letter. I also like being able to quickly create custom lessons by copying text from anywhere and pasting it into the custom lesson form.

Hint: Click the hamburger icon in upper-right corner to change the speed and accuracy required to unlock the nest lesson.

description: L'application que j'utilise régulièrement pour me perfectionner dans la prise de note à 10 doigts. Fait son job à merveilles !!
vraiment didactique et très pratique

J'aimais bien ce logiciel, il est devenu impraticable : plus de menus de configuration, langue anglaise imposée, clavier mal reconnu, etc. je l'ai toujours pratiqué sous debian Gnome avec quelques librairies KDE. Désormais plus rien ne fonctionne, c'est pourtant une méthode remarquable qui ne fait pas de cadeau de fausse aisance lente. Très déçu de cette perte de compatibilité depuis que je suis passé à Debian 10 Gnome.

Очень плохо настроен. Из коробки в режиме новичка стоит 180 символов в минуту. Потратив неделю на первое упражнение никто не захочет выполнять второе.
Очень плохо, что каждый раз надо набирать один и тот же текст. Было бы лучше его генерировать случайным образом.
Первые упражнения на 8 основных клавиш стоит сделать короче, чтобы сразу тренировать все пальцы.
На некоторых упражнениях очень резкий переход делается по сложности набора. То было 2 буквы и сразу 6.
Приложением можно пользоваться только если самому разрабатывать упражнения. Как это может сделать новичек - непонятно.
